materials.raw_text: Hg (Mercury) - 0.5 g, Sc (Scandium) - 11.0 g, Si (Silicon) - 16.0 g, Sm (Samarium) - 5.0 g, Tb (Terbium) - 3.0 g

sourcing.instructions: Hg: Purchase from chemical supply companies or specialized distributors. Sc: Metal suppliers or online platforms. Si: Electronic component suppliers or chemical suppliers. Sm: Rare earth suppliers or metal distributors. Tb: Rare earth suppliers or online.
steps: Hg: Purchase from chemical supply companies or specialized distributors. Sc: Metal suppliers or online platforms. Si: Electronic component suppliers or chemical suppliers. Sm: Rare earth suppliers or metal distributors. Tb: Rare earth suppliers or online.

1. In a fume hood, measure 0.5 g of Hg using a precise scale. 2. Measure 11.0 g of Sc using the same scale. 3. Measure 16.0 g of Si. 4. Measure 5.0 g of Sm. 5. Measure 3.0 g of Tb. 6. Combine all measured materials in a clean, dry container. 7. Stir the mixture thoroughly until a uniform blend is achieved.
preparation.raw_text: 1. In a fume hood, measure 0.5 g of Hg using a precise scale. 2. Measure 11.0 g of Sc using the same scale. 3. Measure 16.0 g of Si. 4. Measure 5.0 g of Sm. 5. Measure 3.0 g of Tb. 6. Combine all measured materials in a clean, dry container. 7. Stir the mixture thoroughly until a uniform blend is achieved.

steps: 1. Place the mixed materials in a ceramic crucible. 2. Heat in a furnace to 800°C for 2 hours to achieve complete melting and alloying of the components.
heating.raw_text: 1. Place the mixed materials in a ceramic crucible. 2. Heat in a furnace to 800°C for 2 hours to achieve complete melting and alloying of the components.

steps: 1. Allow the crucible to cool slowly to room temperature over a period of 6 hours in the furnace to avoid thermal shock. 2. Once cooled, remove the crucible carefully.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Allow the crucible to cool slowly to room temperature over a period of 6 hours in the furnace to avoid thermal shock. 2. Once cooled, remove the crucible carefully.

steps: 1. Remove the solidified alloy from the crucible. 2. Use fine-grit sandpaper to smooth out any rough edges. 3. If desired, apply a protective sealant to enhance surface durability. 4. Allow sealant to cure for 24 hours before handling.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the solidified alloy from the crucible. 2. Use fine-grit sandpaper to smooth out any rough edges. 3. If desired, apply a protective sealant to enhance surface durability. 4. Allow sealant to cure for 24 hours before handling.
